text:
Hope this is the right channel for this, I'm trying to only show certain content in my rich text module to contact with a property set, for contact without this property I want it to display other content, since we can use personalization tokens and hubl in rich text modules it should be a possibility to do this with an if statement. ive tried the following, unfortunately this was not the solution

```{% if personalization_token('contact.segment__c') !== "" %}
Show personalized content
{% else %}
Show generic content
{% endif %}```
I do feel like im on the right path with this, any ideas?
Just use the token `contact.segment__c` without wrapping it in `personalization_token`

Hi <@U9KA594Q3>, Thank you for your suggestion! unfortunately, when using `{% if contact.segment__c !== ""%}` it will still show me the content in the else statement, despite the contact having the segment__c property set
Your `!==` should be `!=` you can just do `{% if contact.segment__c %}` instead
sadly i cant get it to work that way either, perhaps its because im doing it directly in a rich text field? perhaps the usage of hubl isnt as extensive in rich text
No it's on a page, apologies, i forgot to mention that
Are you able to simply print any contact properties and have them show up?
Have you thought about using smart content to achieve this? Thatâ€™s a way to conditionally render content for a module according to a viewer object property

<@U9KA594Q3> - Yeah using both the `personalization_token('contact.segment__c','')`  and `{{ contact.segment__c }}`  I am able to display the correct segment based on contact

<@UN0NUBU3S> - I'm using smart content to display a property, to shed some more clarity. im using this for a thank you page. we have a pricing request form with the option to select what product they want pricing for, lets say "ISM". The thank you page will then have the following message

"Thank you for your pricing request for ISM"

When a visitor has a cookie blocker and/or denied our cookie bot, it will be unable to show the property, when leaving it blank however it will say

"Thank you for your pricing request for"

This is not grammatically correct because of the trailing "for" so i wanted to create an if statement to also get rid of the 'for'

I hope this sheds more light on what exactly am trying to achieve
for now i've solved it by changing the sentencing to "Thank you for requesting `product` pricing" where product is the value if cookies are blocked, else it will show ism for example
